body_html:
I see, pydoc modules imports everything, and "everything" in this case causes what I'm guessing is a symbol conflict. Starting with 1.4 TensorFlow will not cause these symbol conflicts (no RTLD_GLOBAL), but it's possible another package is exporting symbols which cause issues for TensorFlow . Without knowing which other package is causing the issue it's hard to say more (and even then the answer is probably "file a bug with them to not export the problematic symbol globally").

FWIW pydoc modules is working on my machine with TF 1.7ish.

I'm going to close this. Feel free to reopen or comment if you figure out which specific Python package(s) are causing issues.

body:
I see, `pydoc modules` imports everything, and "everything" in this case causes what I'm guessing is a symbol conflict. Starting with 1.4 TensorFlow will not cause these symbol conflicts (no RTLD_GLOBAL), but it's possible another package is exporting symbols which cause issues for TensorFlow . Without knowing which other package is causing the issue it's hard to say more (and even then the answer is probably "file a bug with them to not export the problematic symbol globally").

FWIW `pydoc modules` is working on my machine with TF 1.7ish.

I'm going to close this. Feel free to reopen or comment if you figure out which specific Python package(s) are causing issues.
